title: Understanding SQL Sorting
text: In SQL, the ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order.

title: Ascending vs Descending Order
text: To sort in ascending order, use ASC. To sort in descending order, use DESC. If no order is specified, ASC is the default.

title: Common Mistakes
text: Ensure that the ORDER BY clause is placed after the FROM clause and before any LIMIT or OFFSET clauses.

hintAnswer: SELECT EmployeeName (Comma) HireDate FROM Employees ORDER BY HireDate ASC;
title: Constructing the SQL Query
text: Start by selecting the columns you want to display, then use the ORDER BY clause to sort by the hire date.
